title: Ticket #1822: enforce maximum stage-out size
description:
There should be an option to limit the total size of output files staged out from each job. The user should be able to specify a limit on a per-job basis and the schedd admin should be able to specify a limit that applies schedd-wide. If the admin's limit is less than the user's specified limit, then the admin's limit should win.

The scenario that motivated this proposal was a case encountered at Nebraska in which a user ran 100 jobs that each staged out 5GB of data, filling up the home partition, and interfering with other work.

It would be nice to also limit the total volume of output in some way, but it is more straightforward to limit things on a per-job basis, and even if we had some sort of cross-job quota, it would still make sense to be able to limit output on a per-job basis, so this seems like a good place to start.
